title: will riot ever consider removing champs?
body: cuz i 100% think that removing horrible champs (cough) AHRI would make this game 100x better. anyone else agree? Lol jk i just hate ahri. but seriously will riot every consider removing champs?

replies.body: Crying about Ahri when cancer like Zed, Lee Sin, Yasuo, and Fizz are still in the game and not gutted.
Nope. If there comes a time when a champion no longer fits in the game they'll get an update, but they won't be removed (e.g Warwick, Sion past and Urgot, Evelynn upcoming).

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=PyPvgAbb,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-05-03T07:39:27.706+0000)
>
> Nope. If there comes a time when a champion no longer fits in the game they'll get an update, but they won't be removed (e.g Warwick, Sion past and Urgot, Evelynn upcoming).

Well, Yorick and Urgot for a couple examples were technically removed, as in, technically; where Yorick was literally removed from free rotation as well as restraining him from getting any skins while a similar but equally tragic story, if not just more so, happens with Urgot. Oh and Eve too, I almost forgot there is a champ that goes by that name, I guess it's due to her perma stealth.

But yeah, champs wouldn't be removed outright, you're right, and there is nothing wrong with that either. But still, getting them stuck in an endless existential limbo for eternity until Rito god finally remembers them 1 day isn't the greatest approach either.

http://www.nerdargufy.com/uploads/2/6/1/4/26144516/184783.jpg?369

Oh well.

". But still, getting them stuck in an endless existential limbo for eternity until Rito god finally remembers them 1 day isn't the greatest approach either."

Seems pretty unfair tbh =(

We can't just magically fix champions that have wider/deeper gameplay issues. These things take time, resources and great ideas. Just because they aren't fixed doesn't mean we have forgotten about them. Just because some champions get an update, doesnt mean it happened overnight and "rito god finally remembered them 1 day". it can take month and months of work to go from concept to actuality, and even then some rework concepts don't pan out.

We are consistently working on champion updates and reworks. Visual and gameplay.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202294884-Champion-Update-Schedule

Well, ehhhhh

If Ryze could get reworked like 20 times (I forgot the number, take this figuratively), I think some of the long forgotten champs who were thrown to the side for literally years without anything coming their way, could get some love here and there during the meantime if the resources and time are just distributed a bit more evenly.

It may be unfair of me to imply that Riot doesn't care or doesn't address problems, which I definitely agree, but the matter of fact is that Riot's resource management could be more even across the board so that no one is blatantly left out, at least not to an extent where some champs could be so obscure and for such an extreme period of time they might as well be removed. That's what I was meaning to come across.

That said, at least it seems to have vastly improved from where it was during the height of this, I mean Urgot is finally getting his long waited rework and it's just around the corner, so yeah that's cool and great indeed. And I hope it could get even better in the future.

no, they'll never remove champs.
I think I read somewhere that their biggest regret was ever releasing vlad though.
If Riot ever actually takes that dark turn, I swear I will uninstall this game and refuse to ever play it again.
